trans-unit.source: Represents a log record that has been appended to a sequence.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.Log.LogRecord"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a stream that contains the record data.
A stream that contains the record data.
The <xref href="System.IO.Log.LogRecord"></xref> has been disposed of.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.IO.Log.LogRecord"></xref>.
You should call this method when you finish using the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance.
The <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance in an unusable state.

After calling this method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance, so that the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance was occupying.
Always call <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance.
Otherwise, the resources it is using cannot be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IO.Log.LogRecord> instance's `Finalize` method.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the sequence number of the previous record.
The value of this property is the sequence number that was provided as the `previousUndoRecord` parameter in the <xref:System.IO.Log.IRecordSequence.Append%2A> method.
Aside from its use in enumeration, this sequence number is treated as opaque by the record sequence.
The sequence number of the previous record.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the sequence number of this record.
The sequence number of this record.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the sequence number of the next record.
The value of this property is the sequence number that was provided as the `nextUndoRecord` parameter in the <xref:System.IO.Log.IRecordSequence.Append%2A> method.
Aside from its use in enumeration, this sequence number is treated as opaque by the record sequence.
The sequence number of the next record in the user-specified chain.
